name: places/ChIJWdTc7e9YwokRLcdVUTNpLsY
formattedAddress: 30 E 60th St # 504, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 30 E 60th St # 504, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text: I highly recommend anyone looking to get hair removed permanently to look into electrolysis,. Hairless NYC provided me with amazing results. The owner Lia was very sweet and professional by taking the time and patience to explain the process and differences between laser and electrolysis as I am new to all this. She answered all my questions and concerns thoroughly. I felt extremely comfortable with her so I did my first session the same day! Akiko also worked on me and  she was very kind, took her time, and was extremely sanitary. I highly recommend anyone who is considering hair removal to check out Hairless NYC

originalText.text:
I just completed my 3rd session with Lia at Hairless NYC clinic  and I'm extremely happy with the results!
She was very kind, understanding, and gentle with me especially since it was my first time with electrolysis.
The place is clean and quiet and all  the other staff is always polite.
I highly recommend Hairless nyc clinic.

originalText.text:
I‚Äôve been visiting Hairless NYC about once a week for almost a year now. Never saw much progress but kept at it in hopes something would change.

The electrolysis technicians are pleasant but the company is terrible and has no care or loyalty to their customers. Some examples below:

1. Never educated me on packages available so I paid as I went which added up quickly
2. After months of seeing little results only Akiko offered a suggestion of a different technic. It burned my skin but I appreciated someone was making an effort to help me see better results.
3. Appointment booking is archaic and confirmation is non existent

The breaking point for me was an incident where the receptionist claimed to of called me and left a message to confirm my appointment. No phone call or message was received. This happened 2x in a month. When I asked for the late fee to be waived the receptionist was condescending, unprofessional and unwilling to work with me. I‚Äôve never missed an appointment that was confirmed and the one that was missed was due to lack of communication from Hairless NYC. I felt taken advantage of as a customer. Hairless NYC lost a frequent and loyal customer due to their unprofessionalism but they don‚Äôt care! Don‚Äôt expect them to care about you either - look elsewhere.

originalText.text:
The Hairless NYC group is amazing.

Bella at reception always recognizes you when you walk in or call, and is very on top of receipts and scheduling. She has been very helpful to me with getting receipts for insurance even well after my appointments. Jennifer and Michelle at reception have also greeted me warmly and cordially at each visit, and I have been glad they tolerate my sense of humor!

Ruth has been my electrolysist for the past year and she is incredibly efficient. I‚Äôve been to other places and they can be nicely conversational, but with Ruth you get your money‚Äôs worth. You can tell that she knows her stuff, and that allows more hairs to be zapped in the same amount of time before my swelling gets too bad. She can also remember items we talked about during the last visit, over a month ago. I talked about my working with ELL students one month, and Ruth brought up her translator classes the next.

Finally, I‚Äôm a trans woman. Ruth and Bella have been nothing but professional regarding surgery, the surgical area, and pronouns. I 100% recommend the Hairless Group to all.
